# ğŸ¤– AI Misfires: Learn by Debugging

**AI Misfires** is a web-based educational tool that helps developers sharpen their coding intuition by identifying and fixing common mistakes generated by AI systems.

This project is part of a portfolio to showcase full stack development, front-end design, and ethical AI awareness.

---

## ğŸš€ Features

- ğŸ§  Interactive Python code editor (powered by Ace.js)
- ğŸ§ª Real-time code execution using a Django backend
- ğŸ” Safe evaluation with blocked unsafe Python functions
- ğŸ“± Responsive Tailwind CSS layout
- ğŸ“š About page with project intent and author mission
- ğŸŒ Hosted on [W3Schools Spaces](https://w3schools.com)

---

## ğŸ’¡ Why This Project?

As AI tools become more common in coding workflows, itâ€™s easy to forget that they can still produce flawed or unsafe logic. This app is a friendly reminder that:

> "AI is powerful, but your brain is still the most important debugging tool."

Users can run, review, and fix buggy AI code â€” learning how to spot subtle mistakes and trust their own judgment in the process.

## ğŸ§ª Try It Yourself

If you're using W3Schools Spaces or running locally:

```bash
python3 manage.py runserver 0.0.0.0:3000 --settings=ai_misfires.settings
```

Then open [localhost:3000](http://localhost:3000) in your browser.
